FuncDef:
The user no-family user-max-session command determines whether to switch family users to common users in an AAA domain.
The undo user no-family user-max-session command restores the default configuration.
By default, after the user-max-session command is run in an AAA domain, users with the same user name in the domain are family users.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum number of sessions for common users.
The value is 1.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the user-max-session command has been run in an AAA domain, users with the same user name in the domain are family users. To switch family users to common users, run the user no-family user-max-session 1 command.
If the user-max-session command has been run in an AAA domain, you can run the user no-family user-max-session all command to limit the number of users with the same user name in the domain instead of switching users with the same user name to family users.
Configuration Impact
After the user no-family user-max-session all command is run, the user-max-session command limits the number of users with the same user name but does not switch users with the same user name to family users.
Precautions
The user-max-session max-session-number command must be run in the AAA domain and max-session-number must be set to 1 for the user no-family user-max-session 1 command to take effect.
The user no-family user-max-session 1 command is associated with the user-max-session max-session-number command. The user-max-session max-session-number command must be run in the AAA domain and max-session-number must be set to 1 for the user no-family user-max-session 1 command to take effect.The user no-family user-max-session all and user no-family user-max-session 1 commands are mutually exclusive.To cancel the current configuration, run the undo user no-family user-max-session all or undo user no-family user-max-session command.
